summary: The Allied Burden Sharing Report Act mandates the Secretary of Defense to submit an annual report to Congress. The report will detail the defense spending and contributions to military or stability operations by various countries, including NATO members, Gulf Cooperation Council members, and others, focusing on those participating in collective defense agreements. The report will also cover any limitations on those contributions and actions taken to minimize them. The bill emphasizes the importance of understanding allied contributions for assessing U.S. and allied readiness.
